title: Thought-provoking advert for Danish TV channel goes viral | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share The voiceover explains: 'It's easy to put people in boxes. There's us and there's them, the high earners and those just getting by. 'Those we trust and those we try to avoid. There are those we share something with and those we don't share anything with.' An experiment then begins. The people are asked to step forward if they belong to a 'different group', for example if they were 'the class clown', have ever 'felt lonely' or have been 'a bully'. Suddenly the groups start to merge and mix as members from each section of society realise they have things in common with the other people in the room The people are also asked if they are stepparents or are in love. Suddenly the groups start to merge and mix. The voiceover says: 'Then suddenly there's us. Maybe there's more that brings us together than we think.' The advert has been watched more than a million times on YouTube less than a week after it was published. The advert has been watched more than 1.3million times less than a week after it was launched Hundreds of people have commented on the heartwarming nature of the advert. One commenter said: '.As an American living in Denmark, this video reflects the Danish spirit and sensibility which I consider a resource for the rest of the world. 'Everyone has a strength and Denmark's sense of community is tangible. This video and the spirit, insight and willingness to put it out there makes me proud to be living here.' Another added: 'What a beautiful video. What humanity is meant to be and what it is when humans let themselves be who they truly are.'
